text:
Robin DiAngelo’s 2018 book “White Fragility” argues that our segregated society is set up to insulate whites from racial discomfort, so that they fall to pieces at the first application of stress.

text: In her new photo series, “Behind Glass,” Lisa Sorgini seeks to honor mothers and their children; the title refers not only to isolation but also to Sorgini’s wish to elevate her subjects, to place them on a pedestal. https://t.co/Gt7adctQ2T
